Title: What is the Sharai call for keeping a nickname (substitute, not short name)?
Content:
What is the call for nickname which are not bad, meaning less and not hurting anyone ?

Jawab:

The prohibition is not about the use of nicknames in general, but specifically about bad names which hurt people's feelings.

The best man after the Most Beloved Prophet SallAllahu Alaihi Wasallam was called "Abu Bakr"

The popular Sahaba was called "Abu Huraira"

Sayyiduna Uthmaan Bin Affaan, the 3rd Khaleefah was called "Zun-noorain".

The owner of 2 lights (he married two of the Beloved Prophet SallAllahu Alaihi Wasallams daughters.

So these are names called out with respect. They are not meant to insult or slander anyone.

So a nickname called out to insult someone or exposing a fault or defect is different.

And Allaah knows best.

--------------------------------------------------
Khalifa-E-Huzoor Tajushshariah
Mufti Maqsood Akhtar Qadri Razvi Amjadi

Title: किया बगैर पीर से मुरीद हुए कोई कह सकता है कि मैं फलां का मुरीद हूं
Content:
जवाब:- अगर किसी को बा शरा पीर ना मिले और ये अपने आपको किसी बुज़ुर्गाने दीन का मुरीद कहता है तो इंशाअल्लाह उनके मुरीदों में होगा

Title: नमाज़ के बाद मुसल्ला मोड़ना कैसा
Content:
अक्सर लोगों को देखा गया है कि जा नमाज़ पर नमाज़ पढ़ने के बाद उसका कोना मोड़ देते हैं और उनका खयाल होता है कि ना मोड़ा गया तो इसपर शैतान नमाज़ पढ़ेगा

किया ये सही है

जवाब:- नमाज़ पढ़ने के बाद मुसल्ला यानि कि जा नमाज़ को लपेट कर रख देते हैं ये अच्छी बात है कि इसमें ज़्यादा अहतियात है

मगर कुछ लोग जा नमाज़ का सिर्फ कोना मोड़ देते हैं और ये कहते हैं कि ऐसा ना करने में उसपर शैतान नमाज़ पढ़ेगा ये बे अस्ल है,गलत है

Title: Shah Ki Sari Ummat Pe Lakho Salaam Me "Ummat" Se Kya Murad Hai ?
Content:
Ek Muqrir Ki Nuqta Afrini Par Shareh Bukhari Ki Girfat

Masla

Ek Khatib Sahab Ne Apne Dauran E Khitaab Aala Hazrat Radiallahu Ta'ala Anho Ke Is Shair Ki Tashrih Karte Hue Ke

Ek Mera Hi Rehmat Me Dawa Nahi
Shah Ki Saari Ummat Pe Laakho Salam

Farmaya Ke Is Me Ummat Se Murad Ummat E Dawat Hai.

Isme Kufaar O Mushrikin Sab Sharik Hai.

Dalil Me Yeh Kaha Ke Huzur Aqdas ﷺ Ki Wajh Se Ajaab Aam Se Sab Ko Salamati Hai.

Dusra Qaul Yeh Hai Ke Hazrat Imam Husain Radiallahu Ta'la Anho Ki Shahadat Dar Asal Huzur ﷺ Ki Shahadat Hai.

Jaise Hazrat Syedna Ismail Allaihissallam Ki Jagah Par Dumba Zibah Huwa Tha,

Lekin Zabiullah Hazrat Ismail Allaihissallam Kehlaye Gaye.

Dono Qaul Ke Bare Me Hukm E Sharai Matlub Hai.

Ummid Hai Ke Hum Sab Ki Rahnumai Farma Kar Andullah Majur Ho Gaye.

Jawab:

Is Shair Me "Ummat" Se Ummat E Ijabat Murad Hona Mutaeen Hai.

Un Waiz Sahab Ko Yeh Bhi Zahn Me Aaya Ke Mujjadeed E Azam Aala Hazrat Quds Sira Sari Ummat Par Salam Bhej Rahe Hai Aur Kafiro Par Salam Bhejna Haram Manjurali Ul Kufr Hai.

Isme Shak Nahi Ke Huzur Aqdas ﷺ Rehamatullil Alamin Hai Aur Alamin Me Kufaar Bhi Hai Aur Yeh Haq Hai.

Kafiro Ko Bhi Rehmat E Alam ﷺ Se Kaafi Hisa Mila Hai.

Wujud Khud Bohot Badi Naimat Hai.

Phir Insaan Hona Bohot Badi Naimat Hai.

Phir Insani Quwatein Bhi Bohot Badi Naimat Hai.

Uske Elawa Zindagi Ke Lawazam Wagerah Wagerah Sab Huzur Hi Ki Rehmat Ka Shmara Hai.

Magar Uske Bawajud Un Par Salam Bhejna Kis Tarah Jaiz Hai.

Unke Liye Siwa E Dau E Hidyat Ke Dua E Khiar Jaiz Nahi.

Phir Mujadeed E Azam Aala Hazrat Quds Sira Yeh Nahi Farma Rahe Hai Ke "Ek Mera Hi Rehmat Me Hisa Nahi".

Balke Farma Rahe Hai Ke "Rehmat Me Dawa Nahi" Dawa Ka Matlab Hota Hai Haq Sabit Hona.

Agar Che Karim Aqa E Wada E Ki Bina Par Haq Hona Aur Baat Hai, Hisa Hona Aur Baat Hai.

Koi Sakhi Apne Dushman Ko Bhi Kuch De De To Use Bhi Uske Karam Se Kuch Hisal Mil Jayega.

Lekin Dushman Ka Koi Haq Us Karim Par Nahi.

Behar Hal Is Sher Me "Ummat" Se Murad "Ummat E Dawat" Ka Qaul Karna Khata Hai.

Unhe Bhi Is Se Elaniyah Ruju Karna Lazim Hai.

2) ALLAH Ta'la Waizo Ke Ishtraak E Ma'na Se Ummat Ko Bachaye.

Waiz Ke Liye Alim Hona Shart Hai, Lekin Ab Waiz Nira Karobar Ho Gaya Hai. Har Charb Zuban Waiz Ban Bethha Hai.

Ayat Ke Ma'ni Ko Tod Marod Kar Ahadees Ke Mazmin Ko Rado Badal Karke Ulma Ke Irshad Ko Tod Marod Kar Lachhe Dar Alfaaz Me Bayan Karte Hai. Aur Awam Aise Hi Waizin Ko Sar Aankho Par Bithhate Hai.

Waqiah Yeh Hai Ke Hazrat Shah Abdul Aziz Mohdeesh Dehlvi Rehamtullah Alaih Ne "Sira Ulshahdatein" Me Likha Hai Ke Hazrat Imam Hasan Mujtaba Sar Se Lekar Kamar Tak Aur Syedna Imam Husain Radiallahu Ta'la Anho Kamar Se Lekar Talwe Tak Apne Jade Karim Alaih Sallato Taslim Ke Mushabah They.

Bade Shehzade Ko Shahadat E Khafi Mili Aur Chhote Shahzade Ko Shahdat E Jali.

Is Tarah Dono Shahzado Ki Shahadat Ke Zariyah Huzur Aqdas ﷺ Ko Shahdat E Khafi Wa Jali Dono Hasil Hui.

Unhone Ne Dono Shahzado Ki Shahadat Ko Bamanzila Shahadat E Huzur Qarar Diya.

Aur Waiz Ne Usko Sirf Hazrat Imam E Husain Radiallahu Ta'la Anho Par Fit Kiya, Isi Ko Ishtrak E Ma'na Kahte Hai Ke Kuch Bayan Kiya Jaye, Kuch Chordh Diya Jaye.

Agar Che Mujhe Hazrat Shah Abdul Aziz Sahab Ki Nuqta Afrini Par Kalam Hai

Kyon Ke Us Se Lazim Ata Hai Ke Huzur Aqdas ﷺ Apne Baz Kamalat Ke Usul Me Dusro Ke Mohtaaz The.

Isi Tarah Waiz Ne Jo Yeh Bayan Kiya Ke Syedna Hazrat Ismail Allaihissallato Taslim Ki Jagah Dumba Zibah Ho Aur Zabiullah Wo Kahlaye. Wajh Yeh Nahi.

Zabiullah Kahlane Ki Asal Wajh Yeh Hai Ke Syedna Ismail Allaihissallato Taslim Ke Bas Me Zibah Hone Ke Liye Jitna Tha Wo Sab Kar Diya, Apni Taraf Se Zibah Hone Me Koi Daqiqa Faroguzashat Nahi Kiya.

Waizin Se Is Qism Ki Galtiyah Aksar Hoti Rahti Hai, Isliye Hadees Me Farmaya Gaya :

Waiz Nahi Kahta Magar Ameer Ya Jise Ameer Ijazat De, Hukm De Ya Utarne Wala.

Behar Haal Jab Hazrat Se Shah Abdul Aziz Mohdeesh E Dehlvi Rehamtullah Allay Ne Wo Likha Aur Us Par Aitmaad Karke Waiz Ne Bayan Kiya To Us Se Koi Mawakhza Nahi.

Agar Che Adha Hi Bayan Kiya.

Wallahu Ta'la Allam.

Fatwa E Shareh Bukhari Jild 3 Safah 470

Title: Aala Hazrat Ko Mirat E Risalat Wa Zinnat E Risalat Kehna Kaisa Hai ?
Content:
Jawab:

Mujjadeed E Azam Quds Sira Ko Mirat E Risalat Kehne Me Koi Harj Nahi.

Hadees Me Hai:

Aur Waris Apne Mauras Ka Aainadaar Hota Hai.

Zinnat E Risalat Kehne Me Bhi Koi Harj Nahi.

Zinnat Ka Muzin Ba Se Afzal Hona Lazim Nahi.

Balke Umuman Zinnat Muzin Ba Se Kam Rutba Ki Hoti Hai.

Jaise Taaj Badhshah Ki Zinnat Hai, Magar Badhshah Se Afzal Nahi.

Libaas Insaan Ki Zinnat Hai, Magar Insaan Se Afzal Nahi.

Quran Hakim Me Farmaya Gaya :

زِیۡنَتَکُمْ عِنۡدَ کُلِّ مَسْجِدٍ

Wallahu Ta'la Allam.

Fatwa E Shareh Bukhari Jild 3 Safah 395

Title: Do parcho par ye likha ki jab meri yeh tahrir tujhe pahunche tujhe talaq hai,
Content:
Aur Aurat ko dono Parche Pahunche To Qazi Kitne Talaq Ka Hukm Dega❓

Jawab:

Do parcho par yah likha ki jab meri yah tahrir tujhe pahunche tujhe talaq hai aur Aurat ko 2 no parche pahunche To qazi do Talaq ko Ka Hukm dega.

Dusre se Talaq Likhwa kar bheja to talaq ho jaayegi.

Likhne wale se kaha ki meri Aurat ko talaq likh de to yah iqraare talaq hai.

Yaani talaq ho jaayegi Agarche wah na likhe.

Kisi Parche par Talaq likhi Aur Kahata hai ki main ne Mashaq ke taur par likhi hai to Qaza'an Uska kaul Moatabar nahi. (Raddul Muhtaar)

Bahar-E-Shari'At Hissa 8 Safa 11

Title: Insan ke inteqal ke baad jo ziyarat ka khana hai.
Content:
Uss Khaane par kiska haq hai aur usse kaun kha sakta hai?

Jawab:

Fuqra o masaakin ka haq hai.

Gani ke liye munasib nahin teeja o chaliswan wagairah ka khana.

Agar gani bhi kha len to gunahgar nahin, magar iss tarh ke khane se gani ko bachna chahiye.

Agar malik ne sirf faqeeron ke liye khane ka intezam kiya or uski yehi niyat ho to ab gani ko khana jayez nahin.

Yunhi agar inn mawaqe par bataure dawat khilaya jaye jab bhi ganiyaa ko khana jayez nahin.

Upar ki tafseel se ye baat waazeh hui ke agar malik ne faqeeron ke liye khas na ki ho or na hi bataure dawat ho.

Balke mahaz sawab ke liye madarse mein khana bhijwaye ya unko ghar pe bulakar khilaye to har tarah ke bachhe kha sakte hain.

--------------------------------------------------

Title: Sulah kulli kise kahte hai ?
Content:
Jawab: Sulah kulli 2 tarah ke hai.
  1. I'eteqadi.
  2. Amali.
I'eteqadi: Sulah kulli ye hai keh tamam baatil firqo ko haq par jaane, ya kam azkam kisi ek hi baatil firqah ko haq par jaane. Maslan sunni ko haq par jaane aur saath hi wahabi deobandi wagairah ko bhi haq par jaane. Aur amali sulah kulli ye hai keh sunni ko haq par jaane aur iske muqabil jitne baatil firqe hain sabko baatil o jhoota samjhe. Magar unlogo se dosti kare unke saath khaye piye unki shadi wagaira mein shirkat kare. Dono qism ke sulah kulli se mel jol dosti wagiarh mana hai. Bil khusoos pahle qism ke sulah kulli se mel jol dosti wagairah sakht haraam hai. -------------------------------------------------- Khalifa e Huzoor Tajushshariah Mufti Maqsood Akhtar Qadri Razvi Amjadi Khadim Dar al-Ifta Ridawi Amjadi --------------------------------------------------

Title: Aurat Ko Makka Tak Jaane Me 3 Din Ya Jyada ka Rasta Ho.
Content:
To Kya Uske Saath Shohar Ya Mahram Hona Shart hai Aur khwaah wah Aurat Jawan Ho ya budiya Aur 3 din se kam ki Raah Ho.

To Kya Hukm hai❓

Jawab:

Bagair Mahram Aur Shohar ke Jaa Sakti Hai.

2) Aurat ko makka tak jaane me 3 din ya jyada ka Rasta ho to uske Saath Shohar Ya Mahram hona shart hai. Aur khwaah wah Aurat jawaan ho ya budiyaa Aur 3 din se kam ki Raah ho to Bagair mahram Aur shohar ke bhi jaa sakti hai.

Maharm se murad wah mard hai jisse hamesha ke liye us Aurat ka nikah haram hai.

Khaaw nasab ki wajah se nikah haram hai. Jaise Baap, beta, bhai wagairah.

Ya doodh ke rishte se nikah ki hurmat ho jaise Rajayi bhai, Baap, beta, wagairah.

Ya sasuraali Rishte se Hurmat aayi. Jaise Khusar, Shohar ka beta wagairah.

Gair fasiq hona shart hai, majnun ya naa baalig ya fasiq ke saath nahi jaa sakti.

Aazad ya musalmaan hona shart nahi.

Albatta majusi jiske Ehtekaad me mahram se nikah jayez hai. Uske saath safar nahi kar sakti.

Murahikwa Murahika Ya'ani ladka ya ladki jo baalig hone ke karib ho baalig ke huqm me hai.

Ya'ani murahik ke saath jaa sakti hai Aur murahik ko bhi Bagair mahram ya shohar ke safar mana hai.

Title: What is the importance of Hajj
Content:
In Islam worships are of two kinds: first physical, like Prayers and Fasting, and the second financial, like Zakat.

But Hajj is a unique combination of both.

It is obligatory once in a lifetime, on those who can afford to perform it.

Allah the Exalted declares in the Holy Quran:

“Wa Lillaahi `Alan Naasi Ĥijjul Baiti Manis Tţaa`a ilaihi Sabeelaa. Wa Man Kafara Finnallaaha Ghaniyun `Anil `Aalameen”

(Allah has, therefore, a right on the people that the one, who can afford to reach the House, should perform Hajj there; and the one who disobeys (this command) should know that Allah is All-Sufficient and does not stand in need of any creature of the worlds. Soorah 3: Aayat 97)

Allah the Exalted also orders in the Holy Quran:

“Wa Atimmul Ĥajja Wal `Umratah Lillaah”
(And complete Hajj and `Umrah for Allah. Soorah 2: Aayat 196)

Few Aĥaadith mentioning the importance of Hajj are reproduced below:

1. Hazrat Abu Hurairah RadiAllahu Anhu narrates that the Holy Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam said: “the one who performs Hajj, and does not indulge in any indecency/obscenity and abstain from sins, then such a person returns home from the Hajj free from all the sins like the day his mother gave him birth.”

(Bukhari, Muslim)

2. Hazrat Aayishah Radiallaahu Anhaa narrated that the Holy Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam said: “your (the women’s) Jihaad is Hajj.”

(Bukhari, Muslim) 

3. Hazrat Abu Hurairah Radiallaahu Anhu narrates that the Holy Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam said: “to perform Umrah after Umrah serves as the expiation for sins committed between these two Umrah, and reward for Hajj-e-Mabroor is nothing but Paradise.”

(Bukhari, Muslim)

4. Hazrat Abdullah Ibne Abbaas Radiallaahu Anhumaa narrated that the Holy Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam said: “ An Umrah performed during the month of Ramadhaan is like performing Hajj with me.”

(Bukhari, Muslim)

<script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js"></script>
<ins class="adsbygoogle"

     data-ad-slot="8761528402"></ins>
<script>
     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
</script>

5. Hazrat Abdullah Ibne Abbaas Radiallaahu Anhumaa narrated that the Holy Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam said: “the one on whom a Hajj has become Fardh should hasten to perform it, for verily one never knows what will befall one.”

(Aŝbahaani)

6. Hazrat Aboo Amamah Radiallaahu Anhu narrated that the Holy Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam said “the one who is not stopped by a tyrant, or a need, or disease from performing Hajj, then he may die as a Jew or a Christian.”

(Daarmi)

7. Hazrat Abdullah Ibne Abbaas Radiallaahu Anhumaa narrated that the Holy Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam has said that one who sets out on foot for Hajj from Makkah, Allah will record seven hundred rewards of Ĥaram for each step he takes till he returns to Makkah.

The companions inquired, what is the reward of Ĥaram?

To which the Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wasallam replied that for each good deed in Ĥaram, the reward is one hundred thousand times.

(Ĥaakam)

In simple words, a person who walks from Makkah to Mina, then to Arafat, Muzdalifah, Mina and back to Makkah gets seventy million rewards for each step he takes.

Surely Allah is Most Generous and Most Merciful.

Book: BAHAAR-E-HAJJ

Nawasa E Sadrushshariah

Khalifa Huzoor Tajushshariah

Mufti Mehmood Akhtar Qadri Razvi Amjadi (Qazi-E-Sheher Mumbai)

Title: Preparation For Hajj
Content:
1. Intention: Hajj is nothing but to stay in Arafat on the 9th of Dhul-Hijjah, with the intention of performing Hajj in the state of Ihram and offer Tawaf of Ka`bah during a given time.

A Fardh Hajj is performed but once in a life. Therefore one must perform it with a sincere intention. One should have the intention to perform Hajj, only to discharge his sacred duty and to seek the pleasure of Allah the Exalted, and His beloved Prophet Ŝallalaahu `Alaihi Wa Sallam.

One must not have any ulterior motives, for actions are judged by Allah the Exalted according to intentions. As reported in Bukhari, the Holy Prophet Ŝallalaahu `Alaihi Wa Sallam said: “Verily actions are judged according to intentions and every man is granted what he intends.”

So when one decides to perform Hajj, let one’s intention be solely to gain Allah’s pleasure, and the fulfillment of this obligation, and not sight-seeing, pleasure, trade, nor to gain the title of “Haji”.

The Holy Prophet Ŝallalaahu `Alaihi Wa Sallam said: “There will come a time when the aristocrats amongst my followers will perform Hajj merely for pleasure; and the middle class for trade; and the scholars for show and fame; and the poorer class for the sake of begging.”

May Allah the Most Merciful make us sincere and pious Muslim, and protect us from hypocrisy.

Bear in mind that sincerity is of vital importance.

<script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js"></script>
<ins class="adsbygoogle"
     style="display:block"
     data-ad-format="fluid"
     data-ad-layout-key="-gu-18+5g-2f-83"
     data-ad-client="ca-pub-8429140506595796"
     data-ad-slot="8761528402"></ins>
<script>
     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
</script>

2. Learning of Manaasik: As mentioned earlier, it is a must to study the Manaasik of Hajj before performing it. The Manaasik must be learned under the guidance of a Sunni Aalim. Also carefully and intelligently read authentic matters available on the subject.

Memorize the Talbiyah and all other necessary Du`aa.

It is common to experience that many who go for Hajj and Umrah are negligent in learning these Manaasik. Such people when they reach there and realize that they do not know anything, they turn either to their Mu`allim or their friends, who themselves are also not well conversant with the Manaasik.

In such instances, mistakes are committed due to ignorance. Such a person may feel that he is performing the noble duty of the Hajj or Umrah and cleaning himself from sin and attaining the abundant reward for the Hereafter.

These people happily return home thinking that rewards have been credited to them. Contrary their accounts are filled with sins.

Caution: Do not be lethargic about learning the Manaasik. Do not think that Allah will be pleased with you if you are negligent. So be very careful.

3. Expediting Hajj: Hajj becomes compulsory as soon as one is financially capable of it. This compulsion demands that Hajj be performed in the very year one becomes capable of it. It is a sin to delay it any further. Delaying for several years makes one Faasiq.

Even giving of evidence by such a person is not acceptable. But whenever he performs Hajj, it is considered as Adaa and not Qadhaa.

<script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js"></script>
<ins class="adsbygoogle"
     style="display:block"
     data-ad-format="fluid"
     data-ad-layout-key="-gu-18+5g-2f-83"
     data-ad-client="ca-pub-8429140506595796"
     data-ad-slot="8761528402"></ins>
<script>
     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
</script>

4. Fulfillment of obligations: Prior to performing the Hajj one should fulfill all his human obligations. If one is in debt, he must pay it back or get permission from the creditor for the delay in payment.

If a creditor has passed away, pay all outstanding claims to his rightful heirs. If the heirs cannot be found, even after a thorough investigation, the outstanding amount should be given away to the poor in charity.

If someone has kept anything under his trust he must return the same to its owner or make arrangements for them to be looked after in his absence.

If one has transgressed against some one’s rights (i.e. defamation, physical assault, back-biting, etc.) he must apologize with an open heart and ask for forgiveness.

It is reported in a Ĥadith that when a Muslim comes to his brother and begs for his pardon, it is a must for that person to forgive him. If he does not do so he will not be allowed to visit Ĥaudh-e-Kauthar.

If such a person has any Salaat, Zakat, or any other obligation of Allah unfulfilled, he must repent for the same and start fulfilling them. He must also resolve not to repeat such mistakes in the future.

5. Sincere repentance: One must repent sincerely, and ask Allah, the Most High to forgive all his past sins and transgressions. Regret bad deeds with utmost humbleness and sincerity.

Make a firm resolution to abstain in the future from committing any sins. Regret wholeheartedly and promise Allah not to repeat bad deeds.

Remember, Allah is All Forgiving and Ever Accepting. He may forgive, irrespective of how minor or how major the sins are.

6. Funds for Hajj: Hajj must be performed with wealth acquired lawfully, according to the Sharee`at. Hajj performed with unlawful wealth will not be accepted by Allah the Most Supreme. However, his Fardh of performing Hajj will be fulfilled.

Allah the Exalted is Cleanest and Purest and accepts only that which is clean and pure. If one is doubtful about his earnings he may borrow funds for Hajj and later repay from his earnings.

He must also make suitable arrangements for the maintenance of all those for whom he is responsible (wife, children, and all dependents) until the time he returns to them.

Book: Bahar E Hajj

Nawasa E Sadrushshariah

Khalifa E Huzoor Tajushshariah

Mufti Mehmood Akhtar Qadri (Qazi E Seher Mumbai)

Title: Wajibat of Hajj
Content:
Following are the Wajib acts in Hajj:
1. To don Ihram at the Meeqat limits, though it is permissible to do this even before entering into Meeqat limits.

2. To perform Sa`ee.

3. To begin Sa`ee from Ŝafaa.

4. To perform Sa`ee on foot unless there is a reason to use a wheelchair.

5. To perform Sa`ee after four or more rounds of Ţawaf.

6. If Wuqoof is done during day time, it is Wajib to remain present in Arafat for Wuqoof till sunset. If Wuqoof is done during the night there is no time period of stay in Arafat.

However, the Wajib applicable for a stay up to sunset is missed, hence a Dam becomes compulsory.

7. To be present at least for some time in Arafat for Wuqoof after the sunset.

8. To remain present in Muzdalifah for Wuqoof.

9. To offer Maghrib and Isha prayers together at the time of Isha at Muzdalifah.

<script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js"></script>
<ins class="adsbygoogle"
     style="display:block"
     data-ad-format="fluid"
     data-ad-layout-key="-gu-18+5g-2f-83"
     data-ad-client="ca-pub-8429140506595796"
     data-ad-slot="8761528402"></ins>
<script>
     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
</script>

10. To do Rami of Jamarat as prescribed for three days.

11. To do Rami of Jamarat-e-`Uqbah on the 10th of Dhul-Hijjah, before Halq or Taqseer.

12. To complete the Rami of a particular day on the same day.

13. To do Halq or Taqseer.

14. To do Halq or Taqseer between 10th of Dhul-Hijjah to 12th of Dhul-Hijjah. (i.e. during Ayyaamun Naĥr)

15. To do Halq or Taqseer within Ĥaram limits.

16. For Qaarin and Mutamatti` to offer sacrifice.

17. This sacrifice should be from 10th to 12th of Dhul-Hijjah.

18. This sacrifice should be within Ĥaram limits.

19. To perform four or more rounds of Tawaf-e-Ziyarat between the 10th of Dhul-Hijjah to 12th of Dhul-Hijjah.

20. To perform Tawaf from outside Ĥateem.

21. To perform Tawaf from the right side, that is Kabah should be on your left.

22. To perform Tawaf on foot unless there is a reason to use a wheelchair.

23. To perform Tawaf with Ghusl and Wudu. If one fails to do so Tawaf will have to be repeated.

<script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js"></script>
<ins class="adsbygoogle"
     style="display:block"
     data-ad-format="fluid"
     data-ad-layout-key="-gu-18+5g-2f-83"
     data-ad-client="ca-pub-8429140506595796"
     data-ad-slot="8761528402"></ins>
<script>
     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
</script>

Please note: That is the state when Ghusl is compulsory or without Wudu Tawaf can not be performed.

24. To perform Tawaf without exposing Satr.

25. To offer two Rak`aat after each Tawaf. However, if not offered there is no expiation.

26. To do various acts in the prescribed sequence.

27. For those who are staying outside the Meeqat and have come for Hajj, Tawaf-e-Wada is essential. Women who are not in the state of offering Salaat but have completed four or more rounds of Tawaf-e-Ziyarat are exempted from Tawaf-e-Wada.

28. A person should not indulge in marital relations after Wuqoof-e-Arfah till performing Tawaf-e-Ziyarat.

29. To observe prohibitions of Ihram.

Note: Omission of any Wajib knowingly or unknowingly, intentionally or unintentionally, willingly or unwillingly, entails expiation. However, by the omission of any Wajib, Hajj does not get invalidated.

Book: Bahar E Hajj

Nawasa E Sadrushshari'ah

Khalifa E Huzoor Tajushshariah

Mufti Mehmood Akhtar Qadri (Qazi E Seher Mumbai)

Title: Fard and Sunnah of Hajj
Content: Following are the obligatory (Fard) acts in Hajj: 1. Ihram: To wear the distinctive garb as prescribed. It is the condition of Hajj. 2. Wuqoof-e-Arfah: To remain present in Arafat at least for some time between Zawaal of 9th of Dhul-Hijjah and dawn of 10th of Dhul-Hijjah. It is a Rukn of Hajj. 3. The major part of Tawaf-e-Ziyarat: That is four or more rounds of Tawaf-e-Ziyarat. It is also one Rukn of Hajj. 4. Niyat: To have a firm intention in the mind. 5. Sequence: To follow the prescribed sequence, that is first is to enter in the Ihram, then to do Wuqoof followed by Tawaf-e-Ziyarat. 6. Time: Each act must be performed at its given time. 7. Place: Each act must be performed at its given place. SUNNAH OF HAJJ Following acts is the Sunan of Hajj: 1. Every person entering into Makkah from outside the Meeqaat should offer Tawaf-e-Qudoom, this is a Sunnah for a Mufrid and a Qaarin to offer this Tawaf. Those who are performing Hajj-e-Tamattu` are exempted. 2. To begin Tawaf from Hajr-e-Aswad, and to do Istilaam. 3. To do Ramal either in Tawaf-e-Qudoom or in Tawaf-e-Ziyarat. 4. To run between two green pillars while performing Sa`ee. 5. To start from Makkah after Fajr prayer on the 8th of Dhul-Hijjah for Mina, so as to complete five prayers in Mina. 6. To spend the night of the 9th of Dhul-Hijjah in Mina. 7. To start from Mina for Arafat on the 9th of Dhul-Hijjah after sunrise. 8. To take bath for Wuqoof -e-Arafat. 9. To stay in Muzdalifah for a night while returning from Arafat. 10. To start from Muzdalifah for Mina before sunrise. 11. To spend the nights of 11th and 12th of Dhul-Hijjah in Mina. If one stays back in Mina for the 13th of Dhul-Hijjah, then it is Sunnah to spend the night of the 13th of Dhul-Hijjah also in Mina. Book: Bahar-E-Hajj Nawasa-E-Sadrushshariah Khalifa-E-Huzoor Tajushshariah Mufti Mehmood Akhtar Qadri (Qazi-E-Shehar Mumbai)

Title: What is Meeqat?
Content:
Meeqat are points or stations from where whosoever crosses on his way to Holy Makkah either to perform Hajj, Umrah or for any other purpose, including business, is required to assume the state of Ihram.

Even those people residing within the Haram limit if they go out of the Meeqat, they can not re-enter this boundary without Ihram. It is Wajib to wear Ihram before entering the Meeqat. The Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wa Sallam has specified these places at the most popular routes to Makkah during his time.

A person who approaches Makkah needs to enter the state of Ihram at or before the Meeqat from which he will pass or, if somehow he is not passing through one of them, then a point in his route that corresponds to the nearest Meeqat.

<script async src="https://pagead2.googlesyndication.com/pagead/js/adsbygoogle.js"></script>
<ins class="adsbygoogle" style="display: block;" data-ad-format="fluid" data-ad-layout-key="-gw-3+1f-3d+2z" data-ad-client="ca-pub-8429140506595796" data-ad-slot="5361339443"></ins>
<script>
     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
</script>

If a person is passing the Meeqat in an aircraft then again he should enter in the Ihram before passing what is considered as the corresponding point to the nearest Meeqat. The person can also enter in Ihram before he
leaves his home or before boarding the aircraft.

The one who does not know about Meeqat must enquire from others and if no one is available to guide him he must use his commonsense and decide himself. Anyone crossing Meeqat without Ihram either has to offer Dam in Haram or go back to Meeqat and re-enter after donning Ihram.

If one does not intend to go to Makkah but some other place within Meeqat such as Jeddah, he is not required to wear Ihram. If he thereafter enters Makkah, he can go without Ihram.

There are five different Meeqat:

1. Dhul-Hulaifah: Dhul-Hulaifah is the Meeqat for those who reside in Madinah and for those who approach Makkah from that direction. This is now commonly known as Abyaar-e-Ali. The Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wa Sallam had worn Ihram from here while going for Umrah.

2. Juhfah: This is the Meeqat for the people who come from the direction of Syria. Today the Juhfah has lost its identity and people assume the state of Ihram from Raabigh instead, which is near to Juhfah.

3. Qarnul-Manaazil: This is the Meeqat for the people of Najd or for those coming from that direction. This is near Taaif.

4. Dhaat-e-`Irq: This is the Meeqat for the people of Iran, Iraq and for those coming from that direction

5. Yalamlam: This is the Meeqat for the people of Yemen and others coming from that direction. It is the Meeqat for many of the pilgrims from China, Japan, India, and Pakistan and for those who come from that direction.

Donning the Hajj Ihram before entering the Meeqat is not only permissible but also desirable provided it is not prior to the Hajj period.

Those residing within the Haram limit can wear Ihram for Hajj from any place within the Haram, preferably from the Masjid-e-Haram.

However, if they wish to perform Umrah the Ihram for Umrah should be worn somewhere from outside the Haram limit preferably from the Masjid-e-Aayishah. The area outside the Haram limits is called Hil.

Book: Bahar-E-Hajj

Nawasa-E-Sadrushshariah
Khalifa-E-Huzoor Tajushshariah
Mufti Mehmood Akhtar Qadri (Qazi-E-Shehar Mumbai)

Title: Procedure For Wearing Ihram
Content: It is Sunnah to use Miswaak, and have a bath before putting on the Ihram. If this is not possible, Wudu will suffice. As narrated by Hazrat Zaid Bin Thaabit that the Holy Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wa Sallam had taken a bath before donning the Ihram. (Abu Dawood) The same applies to children and women not in the state of offering Salaat. It is Mustahab to pair the nails and remove pubic hair and that of armpits before the bath. Men may also trim their hair before Ihram. The Ihram for men consists of two pieces of cloth, preferably white and new, one for the lower portion of the body covering from the waist up to above the ankles and the other for the upper portion of the body. The head and face should be left uncovered. No other garments should be worn. The footwear should be such that the center bones of the upper part of the feet (the area of the shoe-lace) must be left uncovered. Women will put on their normal clothes however; their heads must be fully covered. Their faces and hands up to the wrists may be exposed; however, it becomes Wajib to cover their faces if they fear Fitnah. This should be done in such a manner that the covering does not touch the face. Men are prohibited to use socks and hand gloves but women are permitted to do so. It is Sunnah for men to apply perfume on the body and Ihram cloth before making the intention. But no trace or color of perfume should be visible on the clothes. It is against the Sunnah to make Idhţibaa` at this stage. After putting on the Ihram and reaching the airport and completing all the formalities as explained earlier, if it is not a Makrooh time, then offer two Rakat Sunnat-e-Ihram. During the Salaat men will cover their heads with the Ihram sheets. It is Mustahab to recite Surah Kaafiroon in first Rakat and Surah Ikhlaas in second Rakat. After the Salaat men should uncover their heads. Note: A woman not in the state of offering Salaat will not offer it. She will perform Ghusl, put on her normal clothes, which will serve as her Ihram. Book: Bahar-E-Hajj Nawasa-E-Sadrushshariah Khalifa-E-Huzoor Tajushshariah Mufti Mehmood Akhtar Qadri (Qazi-E-Shehar Mumbai)

Title: Niyat of Hajj
Content:
Niyat And Talbiyah
There are three ways to perform Hajj.
1. Hajj-e-Tamattu
2. Hajj-e-Ifraad
3. Hajj-e-Qiraan

According to Ĥanafi school of thought, Hajj-e-Qiraan is considered the most meritorious. The Hajj-e-Tamattu comes thereafter, and Hajj-e-Ifraad is the last.
You are required to pronounce your Niyat after offering the Salaat-e-Ihram.

However, if it is Makrooh time do not offer this Salaat. Merely make the intention and recite Talbiyah.

As mentioned earlier, you can perform Hajj in three different ways.

You have to make the Niyyat accordingly as detailed below:

1. Hajj-e-Tamattu: Hajj-e-Tamattu involves performing Umrah and then Hajj, with separate Ihram for each. Whoever performs Hajj-e-Tamattu is called Mutamatti. This form is considered to be the most convenient of three forms of Hajj. It is the Hajj-e-Tamattu which is usually performed by most pilgrims from India.

If you intend to perform Hajj-e-Tamattu you are required to enter the Ihram with the intention to perform Umrah after offering two Rakaat Sunnat-e-Ihram as explained above. Thereafter men should remove the Ihram sheet from their heads and recite Niyat of Umrah as under:

“Allaahumma Innee Ureedul `Umratah Fa Yassirhaa Lee Wa Taqabbalhaa Minnee Nawaitul `Umratha Wa Aĥramtu Biha Mukhliŝal Lillaahi Ta `aalaa”

(O Allah! I intend performing Umrah, render it easy for me, and accept it from me. I have intended for Umrah and worn Ihram for it, for the sake of Allah only)

The Niyat is nothing but your mental intention, however, to pronounce it verbally is desirable. After making Niyat immediately pronounce the Talbiyah as under:

“Labbaik. Allaahumma Labbaik. Labbaika Laa Shareeka Laka Labbaik. Innal Ĥamda Wan Ni`mata Laka Wal Mulk. Laa Shareeka Lak”

(Here I am at Your service. O, Allah! I am present. I am present, You have no partner, I am present. Verily all Praise and Grace, as well as the entire Universe, is Yours. You have no partner)

While reciting the Talbiyah, the Niyat should be firmly in your mind. It is better to say like this:

“Labbaika Bil Umrah”
(I am present for Umrah)

The Talbiyah is a prayer as well as an assertion of the pilgrim's conviction that he intends to perform `Ibaadat only for the glory of Allah. You start the recital upon changing into the Ihram and continue to recite it as often as possible.

It is Sunnah to pronounce Talbiyah as mentioned above, without omitting any word. It is also Sunnah to pause at the places as indicated above. It is Mustahab to say the Talbiyah thrice whenever recited. Men should say it loudly while women must say it in a soft voice.

It is narrated by Hazrat Zaid Ibne Khalid Radiallaahu Anhu that the Holy Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wa Sallam said that “Jibraeel came to me and said:

O Prophet! Sallallahu Alaihi Wa Sallam Instruct your companions to raise their voices while reciting Talbiyah, as it is from the Sha`aair (ordinances) of Hajj.

(Ibne Majah)

Hazrat Sahal Ibne Sa`d Radiallaahu Anhu narrated that the Holy Prophet Sallallahu Alaihi Wa Sallam said that “ When a Muslim recites Talbiyah, then every stone, tree, and all the area to his left and right utter the same, till it
reaches the end of the earth.

(Ibne Majah, Tirmidhi)

It is undesirable to salute a person who is pronouncing Talbiyah loudly. If anyone does so, the person pronouncing Talbiyah may reply to him after the completion of Talbiyah.

However, if it is felt that the saluter may leave by then, in that case, he may reply while reciting.
After the Niyat and Talbiyah one becomes a Muhrim. (One who’s Ihram is valid.)

Then humbly beg Allah the Most Accepting to forgive you your sins, to save you from the Fire, to grant you Paradise, and to accept your all efforts.

To make the Niyat and recite Talbiyah is Waajib for the state of Ihram to commence. If one makes only the Niyat and fails to recite the Talbiyah or he recites the Talbiyah without the Niyat his Ihram is not valid. In the place of
the Talbiyah if someone says:

“Laa ilaaha illallaah” or “Alĥamdu Lillaah” or “Subĥanallaah”
with the intention of the Ihram, it will be sufficient.

However, to pronounce the Talbiyah is Sunnah. A person who is dumb must move his lips.
If you go beyond the Meeqaat without the Niyyat, it will be as if you are
entering without Iĥraam, though you may be wearing the Iĥraam dress. Dam
will have to be given.
Once you reach Makkah please complete the `Umrah and then come out of
your Iĥraam. You will put on the Iĥraam of Ĥajj later.

2. Ĥajj-e-Ifraad: Ĥajj-e-Ifraad involves performing Ĥajj only. The pilgrim is
called the Mufrid. If you are intending to offer Ĥajj-e-Ifraad then after offering
two Rak`aat Sunnat-e-Iĥraam as explained above you are required to make the
Niyyat for Ĥajj only. It is as under:

“Allaahumma Innee Ureedul Ĥajja Fa Yassirhu Lee
Wa Taqabbalhu Minnee Nawaitul Ĥajja Wa Aĥramtu Bihi
Mukhliŝal Lillaahi Ta `aalaa”
(O Allah! I intend to perform Ĥajj, render it easy for me,
and accept it from me. I have intended for Ĥajj
and worn Iĥraam for it, for the sake of Allah only)
A Mufrid will also recite the Talbiyah immediately after making Niyyat as
described above. Mufrid will say this:

“Labbaika Bil Ĥajj”
(I am present for Ĥajj)
Then humbly beg Allah the Most Accepting to forgive you your sins, to save
you from the Fire, to grant you Paradise, and to accept all your efforts.
After reaching Makkah, a Mufrid will offer Ţawaaf-e-Qudoom, this Ţawaaf is
Sunnah. There is no Idhţibaa` or Ramal in this Ţawaaf. After this Ţawaaf you
are not required to do Sa`ee or cut your hair, as you have made intention of
only Ĥajj. However, if you desire to offer Sa`ee which is Waajib after Ţawaafe-
Fardh at this stage, then in that case you will do Idhţibaa` and Ramal and
perform Sa`ee thereafter. You will not discontinue pronouncing Talbiyah after
Istilaam as the Mutamatti` does. You will remain in the Iĥraam and wait for 8th
Dhul-Ĥijjah. A sacrificial animal is not obligatory when performing Ĥajj-e-
Ifraad.

3. Ĥajj-e-Qiraan: Ĥajj-e-Qiraan involves combining the `Umrah and Ĥajj,
with only one Iĥraam for both. The pilgrim offering Ĥajj-e-Qiraan is called
Qaarin. A Qaarin is required to make Niyyat of both the Ĥajj and `Umrah after
offering Ŝalaat-e-Iĥraam. The Niyyat is as under:

“Allaahumma Innee Ureedul `Umratah Wal Ĥajja Fa Yassirhumaa Lee
Wa Taqabbalhumaa Minnee Nawaitul `Umratha Wal Ĥajja
Wa Aĥramtu Bihimaa Mukhliŝal Lillaahi Ta `aalaa”
(O Allah! I intend to perform `Umrah and Ĥajj, render them easy for me,
and accept them from me. I have intended for `Umrah and Ĥajj
and worn Iĥraam for them, for the sake of Allah only)
A Qaarin will also recite the Talbiyah immediately after making Niyyat as
described above. Qaarin will say as under:

“Labbaika Bil `Umrathi Wal Ĥajj”
(I am present for `Umrah and Ĥajj)
Then humbly beg Allah the Most Accepting to forgive you your sins, to save
you from the Fire, to grant you Paradise, and to accept all your efforts.
After reaching Makkah you will offer `Umrah. When doing Ţawaaf-e-`Umrah
you will do Idhţibaa` and Ramal. After this Ţawaaf you are also required to do
Sa`ee but not to cut your hair, as you have made intention of `Umrah and Ĥajj.
After completing `Umrah you will offer Ţawaaf-e-Qudoom, this Ţawaaf is
Sunnah. There is no Idhţibaa` or Ramal in this Ţawaaf. After this Ţawaaf you
are not required to do Sa`ee. However, if you desire to offer Sa`ee which is
Waajib after Ţawaaf-e-Fardh at this stage only, then in that case you will do
Idhţibaa` and Ramal and perform Sa`ee thereafter. You will not discontinue
pronouncing Talbiyah after Istilaam as the Mutamatti` does. You will remain in
the Iĥraam and wait for 8th Dhul-Ĥijjah to complete your Ĥajj rites.

Note: One who intends to perform Ĥajj on behalf of another (Ĥajj-e-Badal) is
required to pronounce the name of that person on whose behalf he intends to
perform Ĥajj. It is better to say:

“Labbaika Min Fulaan”
(I say Labbaik on behalf of……)
i.e. in place of Fulaan he must take the name of that person. If he does not utter
it is sufficient to mentally intend it.

Title: Maine suna ke kaala joota (shoe) pehne se fikar bad (zyada) ho jati hai
Content:
Aur ye Hazrat Ali karamAllahu wajhahul kareem ka qaul hai.

Kya ye Qaul sahi hai, jawab inayat farmaye.

Jawab:

Jooto ke Rang ke hawaale se koi Hadees meri Nazar se nahi guzri.

Haan! kuch logo ke hawaale se ye Maloom hota hai ke chunke Kaaba Shareef ke Ghilaaf ka rang kaala (black) hai.

Isliye wo kaale joote nahi pahente.

Ye koi Shara'i daleel nahi hai.

Lekin unki imani kaifiyat ka ek haal hai ke wo Adaban kaale joote nahi pahente.

Albatta Peela Joota Pahenna Pasandeeda hai.

Hazrat Maula Ali Karramallahu Ta'ala waj'hahul kareem farmate hain ke "jo peele rang ka joota pehnega uske afkaar (tentions) me kami hogi (Yaani Gam aur fikrein kam hongi)."

Aur kaala joota pahenna naa pasandeeda hai ke isse Huzn o Malal me izaafa hota hai.

Jaleelul Qadr Sahabi Hazrat Abdullah bin Zubair radi allahu anhu siyaah joote pahenne se mana farmate the, ke isse Afkaar (huzn o malal fikrein) paida hote hain.

Wa-Allahu Ta'ala A'lam

--------------------------------------------------
Khalifa-E-Huzoor Tajushshariah
Mufti Maqsood Akhtar Qadri Razvi Amjadi

Title: Ihram Of A Minor
Content:
If you intend to take your minor child with you then:
1.If the child is not matured enough to put on Iĥraam and perform its rituals
himself/herself, then his/her Walee (guardian) has to dress the child
accordingly. Walee has to make the Niyyat on behalf of such a child and see to
it that the child observes all the prohibitions in Iĥraam. Walee will perform all
the rituals of Ĥajj and `Umrah on his/her behalf. However, he is not required to
offer prayers which are Waajib after Ţawaaf on behalf of the child.
If an immature child dons his own Iĥraam and completes the rituals himself
then his Ĥajj is invalid. In this case it is Waajib on the Walee to perform the
rituals on behalf of such child, except prayers which are Waajib after Ţawaaf.
2.If the child is mature enough to put on Iĥraam and perform its rituals
himself/herself, then he/she will put on the dress accordingly. Make the Niyyat
and observe all the prohibitions of the Iĥraam. Such a child will perform all the
rituals of Ĥajj and `Umrah himself/herself.
If the child fails to observe any prohibitions of the Iĥraam or commits any
mistake no expiation entails. Even if child’s Ĥajj becomes Faasid, it is not to be
repeated.
However, this will be a Nafl Ĥajj. After the child attains puberty and if the Ĥajj
becomes Fardh on this child he/she has to perform it on his/her own.

Title: Prohibitions When In Iĥraam
Content:
After one has made the intention and pronounced Ţalbiyah, the state of Iĥraam
begins. Now one is subjected to all the restrictions imposed by Sharee`at. They
are explained bellow.
No sooner one makes the intention of Iĥraam, it is obligatory for one to abstain
from the following:
1. To indulge in marital relations, amorous talks, hugging, kissing with lust
etc.
2. To use obscene and vulgar language.
3. To quarrel with some one in worldly matters.
4. To hunt a wildlife (including wild birds), to aid a hunter in any way.
5. To milk a wild animal.
6. To cook, fry, purchase, or sell eggs or meat of wild animals or wild birds.
To break eggs of wild birds, or to pluck their feathers, or to harm them in any
way.
7. To clip own nails either personally or by any one else, or to cut nails of
some one else.
8. To trim, shave or clip the hair from any part of the body.
9. Males must not wear sewn garments, underwear, gloves, turbans, or socks.
Males should ensure that their heads and faces are not covered at any time.
They are not allowed to carry any bundle of cloth on their heads. Women are
permitted to do so.
10.To use such shoes which cover the elevated bone of the foot.
11.To kill or pick lice, or remove it from the body or hair or to ask others to do
so. Use of lotions to kill lice is also prohibited.
12.To groom hair and apply olive or sesame oil, even if they have no fragrance.
13.To use perfume, aromatic oils, scent and every other thing that has a
fragrance, e.g. Soap, etc.
14.To eat scented items like cloves, musk, cardamom, cinnamon, saffron,
nutmeg, etc.
15.To dye, colour, and apply Mehndi to hair.
16.Clipping, shaving others, be the other person is in Iĥraam or not.
17.To indulge in sins is always prohibited and to do so in Iĥraam is a greater
sin.
All the above acts are Ĥaraam/prohibited in the state of Iĥraam. It is important
to remember that the things which are not permissible in the Iĥraam if done,
knowingly or unknowingly, with intention or without intention, in sleep or
under duress, the expiation prescribed for that particular mistake has to be
given.

Undesirables When In Iĥraam
The following things are undesirable in Iĥraam:
1. To remove dirt or scum from the body.
2. To wash hair or body with un-perfumed soap.
3. To comb own hair.
4. To scratch the head or body in a way that may cause hair or lice to fall.
5. To wear or put on body any cloth which has been put in Loobaan and it still
smells of it.
6. To hide any part of face with cloth.
7. To enter under the curtain of Ka`bah in such a way that either it touches the
head or the face.
8. To use darned or patched Iĥraam.
9. To tie a Ta`weedh in arm even using unstitched cloth.
10.To lie down in a way that face touches pillow.
11.To put bandage without a valid reason.
12.To eat anything in which odourous ingredients have been added and which
are not cooked and still emits odours.
13.To do make up.
14.To join one end of the sheet covering lower part of the body with other end
by a needle or a pin or tie a knot on it.
15.To wear a Lunggi and tighten it with a belt or a waist band.
All the above acts are Makrooh/undesirable in the state of Iĥraam.
Permissibles When In Iĥraam
1. To cover your-self with sewn clothes, not to wear it, in such a way that
neither head nor face is covered.
2. To tuck up sides of Iĥraam clothes in the lower wrapping (Lunggi).
3. To tie a purse to keep money.
4. To wear armaments.
5. To take a bath, be it Waajib or to cool one's body without scrubbing.
6. To dive in water.
7. To wash linen provided it is not for killing lice.
8. To use Miswaak.
9. To sit under shade or use an umbrella.
10. To wear a ring as prescribed by Sharee`at.
11. To use odourless Surmah.
12. To extract teeth or remove broken nails.
13. To cover ears.
14. To clean a boil or an abscess.
15. To undergo circumcision.

16. To remove hair from the eye.
17. To scratch head or body, taking due care so that neither hair nor any lice
falls.
18. To slaughter tame animals such as cattle, poultry, sheep and goats. Their
milking is also permitted. Similarly eggs from farm house can be used.
19. To catch fish for eating as well as for medicinal use. It is not permitted for
entertainment even when not in Iĥraam.
20. To cut grass or tree out of Ĥaram area.
21. To kill crows, snakes, scorpions, lizards, mosquitoes, cockroaches, flies,
bugs, and wild animals which are harmful even in Ĥaram.
22. To put bandage on any part of the body except head and face.
23. To put pillow under the head or cheeks.
24. To put own/some body else’s hand on the nose or head.
25. To use cooked food with cardamom, cloves, musk etc even if it emits its
own odour (e.g. Biryani).
26. To quarrel for religious purpose, if necessary it is Waajib to do so.
27. To use such footwear which does not cover the elevated bone of the foot.
28. To touch sandal wood, Loobaan, and agar wood when not emitting smell.
29. To carry a tray on head.
30. To apply ghee, mustard oil, almond oil, coconut oil etc which do not smell.
31. To marry.
32. To use soft drinks, ice cream, etc in which essence has been added and
cooked. If you are not sure then it is better to avoid them.
All the above acts are Mubaaĥ/permissible in the state of Iĥraam.
The above discussed rules are applicable to both, males as well as females.
However, in the following cases women are exempted:
1.Men are not permitted to cover their heads but women have to do so. In fact
for women it is Waajib to cover their heads in the presence of non Maĥram and
while offering prayers.
2. She is permitted to carry a sack on her head.
3.To groom her hair and apply non-perfumed oil.
4.To enter under the curtain of Ka`bah in such a way that it remains on head
but does not touch her face.
5.To use hand gloves, socks, and sewn clothes.
6.To wear a Ta`weedh around the neck even using stitched cloth.
Note: Women like men are also not permitted to cover their faces. However, if
need be they can cover their faces from non Maĥram using a hand fan or any
thing else so that it does not touch their face.

Title: जैद पहले सब को सलाम करता था मुसलमान समझ कर बड़ा हो या छोटा नमाजी हो या बे नमाजी
Content:
दाढ़ी वाले हो या बगैर दाढ़ी वाले, लेकीन जैद ने जब से ये सुना है कि बगैर दाढ़ी वाले को सलाम करना गुनाह है

उस वक्त से जैद, ने बगैर दाढ़ी वाले को सलाम करना छोड़ दिया है और जैद के दिल में धीरे धीरे तकबबुर पैदा हो गया है

पहले ऐसा नहीं था और लोगों से दुरी होती जा रही है

जैद के दिल में ये ख्याल आता है तकबबुर के तौर पे की मै इन सब से अफजल हुँ बेहतर हुँ

पूछना ये है कि क्या जैद उन लोगों को सलाम कर सकता है

Jawab:

Title: Qurbani Ka Lugwi Aur Istalahi Maana (Meaning) Kya Hai?
Content:
Qurbani Ye Lafz Qurb (قرب) Se Bana Hai Aur Arbi Me Qurb Ka Maana Hai Qareeb Hona, Nazdeek Hona Aur Qurbani Ke Zarya Chu'nke ALLAHﷻ Ka Qurb Aur Uski Nazdiki Talab Ki Jati Hai-

Is Liye Ise Qurbani Kahte Hain

Urdu Zuban Me Qurbani Ka Maana Hai Halal Zabiha. Jisko Khas Eid-Ul-Adha Ke Mouqa Par ALLAHﷻ Ka Naam Lekar Zibah Kiya Gaya Ho.

Jabke Arbi Zuban Me Isi Mafhoom Ki Adayegi Ya Kisi Dusri Shakal Me Nazr-E-Khuda Wandi Ke Liye Qurban Begair Ya (يا) Ke Mustamil Hai.

Quran Shareef Me Hazrat Aadam عليه السلام Ke Dono Farjand Haabil Aur Qaabil Ke Qisse Me Qurban Ka Lafz Aya hai.

Ayat-E-Kareema:- 

وَ اتۡلُ عَلَیۡہِمۡ نَبَاَ ابۡنَیۡ اٰدَمَ بِالۡحَقِّ ۘ اِذۡ قَرَّبَا قُرۡبَانًا فَتُقُبِّلَ مِنۡ اَحَدِہِمَا وَ لَمۡ یُتَقَبَّلۡ مِنَ الۡاٰخَرِ

Tarjuma:-
Aur Aap Padh Kar Sunaye Unhe Adam Ke 2 Beto Ki Khabar Theek Theek, Jab Dono Ne Qurbani Di To Ek Se Qurbani Qabool Ki Gayi Or Dusre Se Nahi.

(5 : سورة المائدة 27)

Qurbani Se Murad Koi Janwar Nahi Jo Zibah Kiya Gaya Ho. Balke Mahaz Nazr-E-Khuda Wandi-Khawah Jins Ki Shakal Me Ho Ya Kisi Janwar Ki Surat Mein.
(تفسير ضياءالقران، جلد:-١، ص:-٤٦٠)

Qurbani Har Is Kaam Ko Kahte Hain Jisse ALLAHﷻ Ka Taqarrub Hasil Kiya Ja Sake Khawah Wo Zabiha Ki Shakal Me Ho Ya Iske Alawa Koi Aur Shakal Mein.
{المعجم الوسيط ص:-٧٢٣}

Isse Malum Huwa Ke Qurbani Sirf Janwar Zibah Karne Ka Naam Hi Nahi.

Balke Taqarrub Ilahi Ke Pesh Nazar Jo Bhi Nek Kaam Kiya Jaye Wo Qurbani Me Shumar Hoga Aur Istalahi Shariat Me Qurbani Ek Maali Ibadat Ko Kahte Hain.


Khas Janwar Ko Khas Dino Me ALLAHﷻ Ke Liye Sawab Aur Taqarrub Ki Niyat Se Zibah Karna Ye Qurbani Ka Istalahi Maana Hai.

Post By: Razaakaar

Title: Maslak E Ala Hazrat Ke Bare Me Yeh Kahna Ke Yeh 5va Maslak Kaha Se Aagaya ?
Content:
Zaid Ek Alim E Deen Hanfi Maslak Ka Hai, Magar Awam Ke Samne Apne Aapko Maslak E Ala Hazrat Ka Paband Kahta Hai Aur Deeni Jalso Me Maslak E Ala Hazrat Zindabad Ka Nara Lagata Hai Aur Awam Bhi Maslak E Ala Hazrat Ka Nara Lagati Hai.

Amar Kahta Hai : Alim E Deen Aur Awam Ko Maslak E Ala Hazrat Ka Nara Lagana Makrooh Aur Shariyat Ke Khilaaf Aur Humare Charo Imamo Ke Maslak Ke Bhi Khilaaf Hai.

Kyun Ke Charo Imamo Ke Maslak Ke Siwa 5va 6tha Ya 7va Koi Maslak Nahi.

Agra Humare Charo Imamo Ke Maslak E Siwa Koi Hota To Maslak E Gaus E Azam Hota, Maslak E Garib Nawaz Hota, Maslak E Mujjadeed E Alfsaani Hota.

Bakar Kahta Hai: Maslak E Ala Hazrat Kahna Ya Nara Maslak E Ala Hazrat Zindabad Lagana Bilkul Durust Hai.

Koi Makrooh Khilaaf E Sharah Nahi Aur Na Hi Charo Imamo Ke Maslak Ke Khilaaf Hai.

Maslak Ka Mani Hai Rah E Rasta Ya Tariqa.

Maslak E Ala Hazrat Huwa Ala Hazrat Ka Rasta Aur Maslak E Ala Hazrat Humare Hi Imamo Ka Maslak Hai Aur Maslak Nahi Aur Aqaid Bhi Alag Nahi.

Mufti Sahab Adban Guzarish Hai Ke Amar Ka Qaul Sahi Hai Ya Bakr Ka Qaul Sahi Hai.

Dalail Ki Roshni Me Jawab Inayat Farmaye.

Jawab:

Zaid Aur Bakar Ka Qaul Sahi Aur Haq Hai Aur Amar Jo Kuch Kahta Hai Galat Aur Batil Hai Amar Ya To Jahil Hai Ke Use Samajh Nahi.

Ya Wo Hasid Aur Anad Ka Shikar Hai.

Aajkal Ahle Sunnat Ko Is Zamana Ke Gumrah Firqo Se Mumtaz Karne Ke Liye Siwa E Maslak E Ala Hazrat Ke Aur Koi Lafz Fit Nahi.

Maslak E Ala Hazrat Islam Aur Ahle Sunnat Wa Jammat Aur Charo Imamo Ke Mazhab Ke Siwa Aur Koi Chiz Nahi.

Mujjadeed E Azam Ala Hazrat Quds Sira Ne Is Mazhab E Islam Aur Ahle Sunnat Wa Jamat Ko Jo Huzur Aqdas ﷺ Se Aaj Tak Mairas Chala Aa Raha Hai, Apni Tahrir O Taqrir Se Waje Kiya.

Ise Phailaya, Iski Taid Wa Himayat Me Dalail E Qaym Farmaya Jiski Nazir Mazi Qarib Me Nahi.


Puri 14vi Sadi Me Koi Aisa Nahi Jisne Islam Wa Sunniyat Ki Himayat Wa Nusrat Me Ala Hazrat Quds Sira Ke Muqable Me Ashir Aishr Bhi Kiya Ho.

Maslak E Ala Hazrat Maslak E Aima Bhi Hai. Maslak E Gaus E Azam Bhi Hai, Hazrat Mujadeed E Alsafni Bhi.

Unke Mazhab Wa Maslak Arbi, Farsi Ki Kitabo Me They Un Sab Ko Ala Hazrat Quds Sira Ne Urdu Me Muntqil Farmaya Aur Uski Isha'at Ki.

Deobandi, Maududi, Sulahkulli Bhi Yeh Kahte Hai Ke Hum Aima Arba Aur Hazrat Gaus E Azam Aur Hazrat Gareeb Nawaz, Hazrat Mujadeed E Alfsaani Rehmatullah Ke Maslak Par Hai.

Is Wajah Se Koi Agar Apne Aapko Yeh Kahe Ke Main Maslak E Guas E Azam, Maslak E Gareeb Nawaz, Maslak E Mujadeed E Alfsaani Ka Paband Ho To Imtiyaz Nahi Ho Payega Ke Sunni Hai Ke Deobandi Hai Ke Maududi Hai Ke Sullahkulli.

Lekin Agar Koi Yeh Kahta Hai Ke Main Maslak E Ala Hazrat Ka Paband Hu To Imtiyaz Ho Jata Hai.

Taibeen Ho Jati Hai Ke Yeh Shakhs Sunni Sahi Ul Aqeedah Hai. Na Deobandi Hai, Na Maududi Hai, Na Wahabi Hai, Na Sullakuli Hai.

Isliye Maujuda Daur Ke Baad Mazhabo Se Apne Aap Ko Mumtaz Karne Ke Liye Yeh Kahna Main Maslak E Ala Hazrat Par Hu, Zaroori Wa Lazim Hai.


Is Par Aitraz Ya To Jahalat Hai, Ya Hasad Aur Anaad.

Mukhtasar Yeh Ke Ahle Sunnat Wa Jamaat Ko Maujda Daur Ke Badmazhabo Se Mumtaz Karne Ke Liye Siwa E Maslak E Ala Hazrat Ke Aur Koi Lafz Nahi.

Wallahu Ta'la Allam.

Fatwa E Shareh Bukhari Jild 3 Safah 387

Title: Kya Alim Be Amal Ki Tauheen Bhi Kufr Hai ?
Content:
Jawab:

Ba-Sabab E Ilm E Deen Alim Be-Amal Ki Tauheen Karna Bhi Kufr Hai.

Alim Be-Amal Bhi Ilm E Deen Ki Wajah Se Jahil Ibadat’Guzaar Se Ba’Darjaha Afzal O Behtar Hai.

Mere Aaqa Aala Hazrat Imam E Ahle Sunnat Maulana Shah Imam Ahmad Raza Khan (رحمة الله علیہ) Farmate Hain Aur Quran Sharif Unhe (Yaani Ulama E Haq) Ko Mutlaqan Waris Bata Raha Hai.

Hatta Ke Un (Me) Ke Be Amal (Alim) Ko Bhi, Yaani Jabke Aqaid E Haq Par Mustaqeem (Yaani Sahi Ul Aqeeda Sunni) Aur Hidayat Ki Taraf Daee (Bulane Wala) Ho Ke Gumrah (Alim) Aur Gumrahi Ki Taraf Bulane Wala (Maulvi) Waris E Nabi Nahi Nayeb E Iblees Hai.
وَالعِياذُ بِالله تعالٰى

Haan Rab ﷻ Ne Tamam Ulama E Shariyat Ko Kaha’n Waris E Ambiya Farmaya Hai ?

Yaha’n Tak Ke Unke Be-Amal Ko Bhi!

Haan Wo Humse Puchye Maula Farmata Hai.

ثُمَّ اَوۡرَثۡنَا الۡکِتٰبَ الَّذِیۡنَ اصۡطَفَیۡنَا مِنۡ عِبَادِنَا ۚ فَمِنۡہُمۡ ظَالِمٌ لِّنَفۡسِہٖ ۚ وَ مِنۡہُمۡ مُّقۡتَصِدٌ ۚ وَ مِنۡہُمۡ سَابِقٌۢ بِالۡخَیۡرٰتِ بِاِذۡنِ اللّٰہِ ؕ ذٰلِکَ ہُوَ الۡفَضۡلُ الۡکَبِیۡرُ

﴿ؕ۳۲﴾ [پ۲۲فاطر۳۲]

Tarjamah: Fir Humne Kitab Ka Waris Kiya Apne Chune Huwe Bando Ko To Unme Koi Apni Jaan Par Zulm Karta Hai Aur Unme Koi Miyanah Chaal Par Hai Aur Jo ALLAH (ﷻ) Ke Hukm Se Bhalaiyo’n Me Sabqat Le Gaya Yahi Bada Fazl Hai. 
[Surah: 35 | Ayat: 32]

Mazkura Bala Ayat E Karima Naqal Karne Ke Baad Mere Aaqa Aala Hazrat Imam E Ahle Sunnat Maulana Shah Imam Ahmad Raza Khan (رحمة الله علیہ) Mazeed Farmate Hain Dekho Be Amal (Ulama) Jo Gunaho Se Apni Jaan Par Zulm Kar Rahe Hain Unhe Bhi Kitab Ka Waris Bataya Aur Nira (Yaani Faqat) Waris Hi Nahi, Balke Apne Chune Hue Bando Me Gina.

Ahadees Me Aya Rasool’Allah ﷺ Ne Is Ayat Ki Tafseer Me Farmaya.

Hum Me Ka Jo Sabqat (Bartari) Le Gaya Wo To Sabqat Le Hi Gaya Aur Jo Mutawassit (Yaani Darmiyana) Haal Ka Huwa Wo Bhi Najaat Wala Hai Aur Jo Apni Jaan Par Zalim (Yaani Gunahgaar) Hai Uski Bhi Magfirat Hai.
[تفسیر دُرّمنثور ج۷ ص۲۵]

Alim E Shariyat Agar Apne Ilm Par Aamil Bhi Ho (Jab To Wo Misl) Chand Hai Jo Ke Aap (Khud Bhi) Thanda Aur Tumhe Bhi Roshni De Warna (Aalim Be Amal Misl) Shamma Hai Khud To Jale Magar Tumhe Nafa De.

Rasool’Allah ﷺ Farmate Hain Us Shaksh Ki Misaal Jo Logo Ko Khair (Yaani Bhalai) Ki Taleem Deta Aur Apne Aap Ko Bhool Jata Hai Us Fatile (Yaani Chiragh Ki Batti) Ki Tarah Hai Logo Ko Roshni Deta Hai Aur Khud Jalta Hai.
[Fatawa Razviya/Jild:-21/Page:-530-531]

Posted By: Razaakaar

Title: Masah Raas Ka Behtarin Tariqa Kya Hai?
Content:
Fatwa E Mustafwiyah Ki Ek Ibarar Ki Tawajah

Masla

Kya farmate hai ulma deen wa muftiyan e Sharah matin masail e mandarja zail me ke 1 (ek) Kutub E hadees Wa Fiqah me Sar Ke Masah Karne Ka Masnun Tariqa Yun Bayan kiya Gaya Hai ke Dono Hath Ke anguthe Kalma ki ungliya Chordh kar Baqi Tin Tin Ungliyon ke Sar Ko Mila Kar Peshaani ke baal Ke Aage ki Jagah Par Rakhe Aur Sar Ke upari Hise Par Gadi Tak Ungliyon Me Pet Se masah Karta Huwa Le Jaye aur Hatheliya Sar Se juda Rahe.

Phir Hatheliya Se Sar Ki Dono Karwato Ka Masah Karte Hue Peshaani Tak Wapas Laye.

Yahi Tariqa Mash'hur Wa Maruf Ulma e Kiram Ka Mamul hai.

Lekin Huzur Mufti E Azam E Hind Allaihirrahma Ne Apne Fatwa Mubarak Me Tahrir Farmaya Hai Ke Teen Teen Ungliyah Aur Hatheliya Muqdam Raas Se Is Tarah Janib Gardan Le Jaye ke Sar Ke Dono Janib Bhi Puri Hatheliyon Ke Niche Aati Jaye.

To Us Surat Me Yunhi Pure Sar Ka Masah Ho Gaya, Pichhe Se Aage Lana Bekar Hai Aur ala Yahi Hai.

(Fatwa E Mustafwiyah Jild 2 Safah 60)

Huzur Mufti E Azam Hind Quds Sira Ka Mamul Sharif Isi Masah Karne Ka Tha.

Is faqir Ka bhi Mushahida Hai Aur Mukrami Janaab Abdul Naeem Azizi Sahab Madzila Ul aali Ne Apni Taalif Masmah Ba Huzur Mufti E Azam e Hind Quds Sira Safa 41 me Is Mamul Sharif Ka Zikr Bhi Kiya Hai.

Fatwa Mubarak Me Hadees Wa Fiqah Ki Ibarat Ba Hawala Darj Nahi Hai Aur Sar ke Masah Karne Ka Yahi Tariqa Ala Bhi Farmaya Hai.

Lehaza Is Masla Ko Dalail Se Mazin Farmaye Taake Yeh Masla Khub Achchi Tarah Wajeh Ho Jaye.

Mustfati: Qazi Mohammad Ata ul Haq Usmani Gondwi

Sayyedi Ul Karim Jad Ul Muazam Huzur Mufti E Azam e Hind Quds Sira ul Aziz Ne Jo Farmaya Wahi Azhar Hai Uski Sanad Tabyiyan Wa Hindiya Me Hai:

Aur Iske Bar Akas Dusra Tariqa Mukhtaar Nahi.

Balke Allama Ibn Alhamaam Ne Farmaya Ke Sunnat Me Iski Asal Nahi Chunache Radd Ul Mohtar Me Hai.

Tarjumah

Dono sabaab Aur Abhaam (Shahadat Ki Ungli Aur Anguthe) Ko Bawaqt E Masah Juda Rakhe. Yani Phaila De Aur Abhaamman (aanguthe) Se Take Unse Kano Ka Masah Kare Aur Hathheli Bhi Phailaye Rahe Taake Usse Sar Ke Kinare Ka Masah Kare Aur Yeh Ehtiyat Isliye Ke Masah Ka Paani Mustmil Na Ho Jaye Aur Fatah Me kaha Iski Sunnat Me Koi Asal Nahi.

Isliye Ke Qabl E Ansaal Istemal Sabit Hi Nahi Hota Aur Kaan Sar Hi Hai.

Wallahu Ta'la Allama

Fatwa E TaajhuSariah Jild 3 Safah 22

محفلِ غُلاماٰنِ مُصطٰفی ﷺ

Title: Ala Hazrat Salehin Ke Imam They. Unpar Par Salaam Padna Kaisa ?
Content:
Ek Shakhs Kahta Hai Ke Ala Hazrat Azim Ul Barkat Kon Hote Hai, Kaha Se Aaye Hai Jo Unpar Salam Padha Jaye Aur Mujahid E Millat Rehmatullah Allay Kaun Hai Aur Kaha Se Aye Hai Jo Ke Un Par Salam Pada Jaye.

Aur Kahta Hai Ke Aajkal Sunni Log Ek Nayi Dhum Macha Rakhe Hai Ke Subah Ko Salam Padte Hai, Jumuah Ke Baad, Eid Ke Baad Salam Padte Hai.

Khud Mazkura Shakhs Masjid Me Salam Padte Waqt Kuch Na Kuch Kam Ke Bahane Fauran Masjid Se Bahar Chala Jata Hai.

Phir Salam Khatam Hone Ke Baad Masjid Ke Andar Aa Jata Hai.

Is Qism Ke Alfaz Kahne Wale Aur Is Qism Ka Mardud Aqeedah Rakhne Wale Ke Liye Shariat E Islamiyah Me Kya Hukm Hai.

Sharai Dalail Se Nawaze.


(Ala Hazrat Aur Mujjahid E Millat Ke Naam Azim Ul Barkat Aur Rehamtullah Allaysallam Maine Likha Hai, Us Shakhs Ki Zubaan Se Nahi Suna)

Jawab:

Uske Jumle Se Zahir Ho Raha Hai Ke Yeh Shakhs Ulma E Ahl Sunnat Wa Akabir E Ahle Sunnat Se Sakht Adawat Rakhta Hai.

Balke Tamaam Ahle Sunnat Se Bugz Rakhta Hai.

Niz Mutrshah Hota Hai Ke Uske Dil Me Huzur Aqdas ﷺ Ki Azmat Nahi, Warna Durood O Salam Se Chidta Nahi, Usko Dhoom Machaane Se Tabir Nahi Karta.

Yeh Bhi Us Par Qarina Hai Ke Yeh Andar Andar Bad Mazhab Hai Aur Malum Hota Hai Ke Bohot Bada Jahil Hai.

Balke Ajhal Hai.

Altiyat Me Hai :

السلام علینا و علی عباد اللّٰه الصالحین

Hum Par Salam Ho Aur ALLAH Azwajjal Ke Tamaam Naik Bando Par.

Yaqinan Ala Hazrat Imam Ahmad Raza Quds Sira Sirf Saleh Hi Nahi They, Balke Imam They Aur Hai Aur Mujahhid E Millat Rehmatullah Allay Tamaam Salehin Nahi To Karodo Salehin Ke Imam They.

Isliye Atiyat Ke Mutabiq Un Sab Par Salam Padha Jata Hai.

Wallahu Ta'la Allam.

Fatwa E Shareh Bukhari Jild 3 Safah 395

Title: Ghar Me Ek Masla Ho Gaya Hai Ke Hamare Me Cousin Bhai Aur Unki Wife Ke Beech Kisi Wajha Se Jhagda Ho Gaya
Content:
Aur Usme Bhai Ne Gusse Me Bhai Ne Bhabhi Ko 6 Martaba Talak Keh Diya Aur Ab Wo Dono Sath Rehna Chahte Hai.

To Iska Kya Haal Hai? Zara Rehnumai Farmaye.

Kya Unka Talak Ho Gaya? Aur Agar Ho Gaya To Dobara Nikah Me Aane Ke Kya Masle Hai?

Jawab:

Mazkoora Surat Me Agar Aap Ke Bhai Ne Apni Biwi Ko 6 Talaaqein De Di Hain.

To Ab Wo Aap Ke Bhai Ke Liye Bilkul Haraam Ho Gayi.

Ab Begair Halala Un Dono Ka Apas Me Nikah Bhi Nahi Ho Sakta.

Title: Mas'ala Ye Hai Ke Railway Ka Ye Rules Hai Ke Jab Train Aakhri Station Par Pahunchti Hai
Content:
To Waha Par Train Khali Hone Ke Baad Train Ki Safaii ki Jati Hai.

Tab Kaii Baar Train Me Passenger Ka Bhula Hua Samaan Milta Hai.

To Wo Samaan Railway Office Me Jamaa Karaya Jata Hai.

Fir Railway Officers us Samaan Ki Taftish Karke Uske Maalik ko Dhundne ki Koshish Karte Hai.

Jab us Samaan ka Koi Waris Nahi Milta to Us Samaan ko Railway Ki Tai ki Hui Muddat Tak Railway Office Me Rehta Hai.

Fir Uski Muddat Khatam Hone Par Wo Samaan Haraaji Me Bech Diya Jata Hai.

To Aisa Samaan Haraaji Me Se Kharidna Kaisa Aur us Samaan Ka Istemaal Karna Kaisa?

Jawab:

Jab Kisi Musalman Ka Maal Mile aur Wo Maal us Ke Malik Tak Na Pahoch Sake to Kisi Faqeer ko Diya Jaaye.

Lehaza Mazkoora Surat Me Us Samaan Ko khareedna Jaayez na Hoga.

| PART- ⑤④ |

? Sawal (1) :
•-•-•-•-•-•-•-•

Sawal : Kya Farmate hain Olma-E-deen Wa Muftiyane Shara e Matin IsMasle me...

⤵⤵⤵⤵⤵⤵⤵⤵⤵

Aurato ki Mazarat par Hazri k liye shariyat ka kya huqm hay?(Haram hay?)

Maheram-NaMaheram ka huqm Marne k bad bhi hota hay?
(Aurato ki mazar par mard aur
Mard ki mazar par Aurat ka jana)

Hazrat ho sake to fatawa Razviya Sharif ka reference no dijiyega
Jazakallah

✍ Jawaab (1) :
•-•-•-•-•-•-•-•

Aurato ka Qabro par jaana ikhtelaafi Mas'la hai, Aksar Ahl e Ilm ise Haraam Ya Makrooh e Tahreemi Kahte hain, ye ikhtelaaf yu paida hua ke ek zamaane me Qabro par jaana sab ko mana tha, Mardo ko bhi aur Aurato ko bhi. Baad me Huzoor pur Noor ﷺ ne is ki Ijaazat ataa farma di aur irshad farmaaya:
"Qabro ki ziyarat kiya karo, wo Akhirat ki yaad dilaati hain".

Jo hazraat Qabro par jaane ko jaayez rakhte hain un ka kehna hai ke ye ijaazat jo Huzoor ﷺ ne Ataa Farmaayi, Mardo aur Aurato sab ko shamil hai.

Aur Jo Hazraat Na jaayez kehte hain un ka istedlal ye hai ke Huzoor ﷺ ne aisi aurato par Laanat farmaayi hai jo qabro ki ziyarat ke liye jaayen, lehaaza Qabro par jana un ke liye Mamnol aur Moojib e Laanat hoga.

Aur Ulama ye bhi farmaate hain ke Auraten ek to Shara'i Masaail se kam waqif hoti hain, dosre un me sabr, Hausla aur zabt kam hota hai, is liye un ke Haq me Gaalib andesha yahi hai ke ye wahan jaa kar Cheekh pukaar karengi, Be Pardagi hogi, Ya Koi Bid'at khadi karengi, Shayed isi Andeshe ki bina par Huzoor ﷺ ne un ke Qabro par jaane ko Moojib e Laanat farmaaya

Huzoor Sadrush Shariah Irshad Farmaate hain:
Mazhab e Saheeh ye hai ke Hadees
"لعن الله زوارات القبور"
Mansookh hai ye Hukm muqaddam hai aur dosri Hadees Jis me ziyarat e Quboor ki ijazat hai wo Muta'kkhar o Naasikh hai.
Wo Hadees ye hai
"كنت نهيتكم عن زيارة القبور الا فزوروها"
Is Hadees me agar che segha muzakkar hai magar ye amr muqarrar aur saabit hai ke khitabaat e Shara'iyyah me agar che segha muzakkar hai Auraten bhi is me dakhil hain jab tak daleel e Shara'i se rijaal ki khususiyat saabit na aur Hadees
"النساء شقائق الرجال"
Is ki kashif hai. Lehaaza ziyarat e quboor se Aurato ko murtakib e Fe'l e Haraam nahi kaha jaayega. Agar che hamaare nazdeek aslam tareeqa ye hai ke Aurato ko ziyarat e quboor se mana kiya jaaye kyu ke un me ifraat o tafreet ka Maaddah gaalib hai aur surat e Mas'oola me hijaab aur Adaab e e'zaaz ka pura lehaaz kiya gaya hai. Lehaaza hukm me aur mazeed khiffat paida ho gayi.(fatawa Amjadia jild 1 safah 327)

Huzoor Sayyedi Alahadrat Farmaate hain:
"Meri Raaye is masle me khilaaf par hai, muddat hui mera fatwa Tohfa e Hanafiyya me Chhap chuka, mai us Rukhsat ko jo Bahr ur Raayeq me likhi maan kar Nazr ba Halaat e Nisaa Siwa e Hazri e Rauza e Anwar ke k Waajib ya Qareeb ba Waajib hai, Mazaraat e Aulia ya Deegar Quboor ki ziyarat ko Aurato ka jaana Ba Itteba e Guniya Allama Muhaqqiq Ibraheem Halabi Har giz pasand nahi karta khususan is tufaan e be tameezi raqs o mazameer o surood me jo aaj kal johhaal ne A'raas e Tayyeba me barpa kar rakha hai is ki shirkat to mai awaam e rijaal ko bhi pasand nahi rakhta na ke wo jin ko Anjasha Radi-Allahu Ta'ala Anh ki Hadi Khwani ba ilhaan e Khush par Aurato ke saamne Mumaana'at farma kar unhe nazuk sheeshiyaan farmaya gaya" (Fatawa Razaviyyah mutarjam jild 23 safah 111)

Lehaaza Mazkoora Baala Aqwaal e Foqaha se Ye Saabit ho gaya ke Aurato ke Mazaraat par Jaana fi zamaanina Na jaayez o Haraam hai aur is ki Mumaana'at Mahram o Gair Mahram ki Buniyaad par nahi balke Un ki Parda Nasheeni aur Aaj kal hone waale khoraafaat o bad tameezi ki buniyaad par hai ..

Haan ye sahi hai ke biwi ke marte hi Duniyawi Ahkaam ke etebar se miya biwi ka rishta khatam ho jaata hai, aur Shauhar ki haisiyat ek lehaaz se ajnabi ki ho jaati hai.
Yahi wajah hai ke biwi ke inteqal ke baad shauhar apni biwi ki maiyyet ko bila haayel hath nahi laga sakta. .. wa-Allahu Ta'ala A'lam

Deen e Islam Ne Apne Manne Waalo Ko Jhoot Bolne Se Mana Kiya aur Sach Kehne Ki Takeed Ki Hai.
Jis Tarah Jhoot Bolna Bura Hai Usi Tarah Jhoota Amal Bhi Bura Hai Aur Us Ki Mumaana´at Aayi Hai.
Jis Tarah Qaul (Baat) Ki Sacchaai Matloob Hai Usi Tarah Amal Ki Sacchaai Bhi Matloob Hai.
Waada Khilaafi Amali Jhoot Me Shumar Hota Hai, Aur Waada Pura Karna Amali Sidq (Sacchaai) Kehlata Hai.

Islam Me Badi Takeed Ke Sath Ahed Ko Pura Karne Ka Hukm Aur Ahed Shikni Ki Mazammat Hai.
Lehaza Qur'an e Majeed Me Allah Ta'ala Ka Irshad Hai
واوفوا بالعهد ان العهد كان مسؤولا
?Maf'hoom:• Ahed Ko Pura Karo , Kyu Ke Qiyaamat Ke Din Ahed Ke Baare Me Insan Jawaab Deh Hoga.

Qur'an Ne Un Logo Ki Tareef Ki Hai Jo Apne Ahed Ka Paas o Lehaaz Rakhte Hain. Irshad e Baari Ta'ala Hai
والذين هم لاماناتهم وعدهم راعون
Aur Jo Log Apni Amaanato Aur Apne Waado Ki Paasdari Karne Waale Hain.

Khud ALLAH Tabaarak Wa Ta'ala Ne Apni Sifat Ka Kai Jagaho Par Zikr Farmaaya Hai Ke ALLAH Waada Khilafi Nahi Farmaata.
Rasoolullah ﷺ ne Apne Irshadaat Ke Zariye Bhi Ifaa e Ahed ki Ahmiyat Aur Waada Khilafi Ki Buraai Bayan Farmaayi Hai.
Yahan Tak Ke Huzoor ﷺ ne Munaafiq Ki Nishaanio Me Se Ek Nishani Waada Khilaafi Bataaya,
Hadees e Paak Me Hai Rasoolullah ﷺ ne Farmaya: Munafiq Ki 3 Alaamate Hain ①• Jab Baat Kare To Jhoot Bole
②• Jab Waada Kare To Khilaf Warzi Kare
③• Aur Jab Us Ke Paas Amaanat Rakhwaai Jaaye To Us Mekhayaanat Kare.

Ye Niyyat Ki Bad Diyaanati Ka Aur Jhooti Niyyat Ka Nateeja Hai. Kyu Ke Admi Gunahgar Us Waqt Hai Jab Waada Ya Ahed Karte Waqt Us Ki Niyyat Hi Wafa Ki Na Ho Ya Baad Me Wafa Ki Niyyat Par Qaayem Na Rahe.
Agar Niyyat Waada Wafa Karne Ki Hai Magar Halaat Ke Hatho Be Ikhtiyaar Hone Ki Waja Se Waada Wafa Na Kar Saka To Us Par Muaakhza Nahi.

Waada Khilafi Ek Akhlaaqi Jurm Bhi Hai Aur Shar'an Bhi.

Title: Hazrat Namaz Mein Ya khaana khaate waqt topi pehna kaha se sabit hai
Content: Kya ye sunnat tarika hai ya sirf adab ke lihaz se hai ? Jawab: Namaz me sar dhankne se Muta'lliq Huzoor sadrushshari'ah badruttariqah عليه الرحمة والرضوان irshad farmate hain Susti se nange sar namaz padhna yani topi pahanna bojh ma'loom hota ho, ya garmi ma'loom hoti ho makrooh e tanzihi hai Aur agar tahqeer namaz maqsood Hai. Maslan namaz koi aisi muhtam bishshan chiz nahi jiske liye topi amamah pahna jaaye to ye kufr hai aur khushu o khuzu ke liye sar barhana padhi to mustahab hai. Namaz mein topi gir padi to utha lena afzal hai. Jab keh amal e kaseer ki haajat na pade warna namaz fasid ho jaayegi aur baar baar uthani pade to chhod de aur na uthane se khuzu maqsood ho to na uthana afzal hai (Bahar e shari'at hissa 3 safah 171 makroohaat ka bayan) Hadees shareef mein hai sarkar e aqdas صلی اللہ تعالی عليه وسلم irshad farmate hain keh hamare aur mushrikeen ke maa bain ye farq hai keh hamare hamare amaamah topiyo par hote hain. (Tirimzi shareef / Bahar e shari'at hissa16 safah 41 libas ka bayan) Maujoodah zamane mein wahabi gair muqallid topi pahanne se inkar karte hain aur unke baare mein Aala hazrat azeemul barakat saiyyiduna imam ahmad raza fazil e barailvi رضى الله تعالى عنه irshad farmate hain Gair muqallideen zamana bahukm e fuqha o tasreehaat e aamma e kutub e kutub e fiqhiyya kafir the hi aur tajarba ne sabit kar diya keh woh zaroor munkiraan e zarooriyaat e deen hain aur unke munkiro ke haami o hamraah to yaqeenan qat'an ijma'an unke kufr o irtedaad mein shak nahin. (Fatawa razviyyah jild 3 safah 355) Aur rahi baat khana khate waqt to ye khane ke Adaab se hai ke Sar dhank kar khaya jaaye aur imam o topi pahenna Momin ki shaan aur kuffar se imtiyaz ka ek Nishaan o Alaamat hai. Jab Aap Mareez Hote Hain To Aap Ki Aql Kya Kehti Hai Ke Aap Kis Ke Paas Jaayen? Engineer Ke Paas? Baniye Ke Paas? Ya doctor Ke paas?
Zahir Hai Ke Aql Doctor Ke Paas Jane Ka Hukm Karti Hai.
Jab Insan Khud Shariat Se Waqif Na Ho Aur Jahannam Me Jaane Se Bachne Ke Liye Shariat Par Amal Karna Chahta Ho To Masaail Poochne Ke Liye Kis Ki Taraf Ruju Kare? Alim e Deen Ki Taraf? Ya Jahil Ki Taraf? Aql e Saleem Yahi Kehti Hai Ke Us Ki Taraf Ruju Kiya Jaaye Jo Deen Ke Ahkam Me Waqif Ho Aur Alim e Deen Ho.
Wo Alim e Deen Ya Khud Deen Me Specialist Hoga Ya Kisi Specialist Ke Nuskhe Ko Bataayega Usi Specialist Ko Mujtahid Kehte Hain Aur Us Ke Fatwe Par Amal Karne Ko Taqleed.

Islami Shariat Ki Aslan ③ Buniyaden Hain.
①• ALLAH Ki Kitaab (Qur'an Majeed)
②• Sunnat e Rasool ﷺ (Hadees e Nabavi)
③• Ijma e Ummat.

Kitabullah Asl ul Usool Hai, Aur Sunnat Kitabullah Ki Tashreeh Hai, Aur Ijma e Ummat Baaz Sunnat Ka Bayan Hai.
Kitab o Sunnat Ke Ahkam Ki Koi Na Koi illat Zaroor Hoti Hai, Albatta Kabhi Wo Illat Zahir Hoti Hai Aur Kabhi Makhfi (Poshida) , Makhfi Illato Ko Muta'iyyan Karna Bahot Dushwar Hai, Is Kaam Ke Liye Badi Diqqat e Nazar Ki Zarurat Hoti Hai.
Ummat Ke Baaz Ahl Ullah Se Allah Ne Ye Khidmat Li Jin Ki Qur'an o Hadees Aur Mizaaj e Shariat Par Gahri Aur Puri Nazar Thi, Ummat Ka Siwaad e Azam Salafan Wa Khalfan Qarnan Baad Qarnin Un Ki Imamat Aur Jalalat e Shan Ka Qaayel Hai, Makhfi Illato Ko Muta'iyyan Kar Ke Naye Naye Masaail Ke Ahkam Ma'loom Karne Ka Naam Ijtehad Hai, Aur Ilal e Mutlaqa Par Gair Mansoos Masaail Ko Muntabiq Kar Ke Illat e Mushtarika Ki Bina Par Mansoos Hukm Ko Gair Mansoos Ke Liye Sabit Karne Ka Naam Qiyaas Hai. Lehaza Qiyaas Ki Buniyad Kitabullah o Sunnat aur Ijma e Ummat Hi Hai.
Is Se Maloom Hua Ke Aimma Ke Mujtahidaat (Ijtehadi Masaail) Yaani Fiqh Haqeeqat Me Hadees Hi Ka Nateeja Hain, Hadees Ke Muqabil Me Koi Nayi Cheez Nahi Hai, Neez Is se ye Bhi Maloom Hua Ke Ijtehaad Aur Qiyaas Karna Har Ek Ke Bas Ki Baat Nahi Jabke Masaail Par Chaahe Qadeem Hon Ya Jadeed Shar'an Amal Karna Zaruri Hai,
Is Liye Ummat Ke Qabil e Etebar Ulama e Deen Ka Kisi Ek Imam Ki Taqleed Par Ijma Hai.
Khususan Is Zamaane Me Jabke Shariat Par Ama Karne Ke liye Himmaten Past Hain, Nafs Me Khwahishat Ka Dakhal Hai Aur Khud Raayi Ka Galba Hai.

Agar Admi Ko Bilkul Azad Chhor Diya Jaaye Ke Wo Jis Mazhab Aur Jis Imam Ki Pairwi Karna Chahe Pairwi Kare To Chunke Is Zamane Me Khwahishat Ka Galba Hai, Admi apni Garz Aur Khwahish ke mutabiq jo surat har Mazhab Me Se Apne Matlab ki Paayega ikhtiyar kar lega, aur jo us ke matlab ke khilaf hoga us ko na maanega, aisi surat me Deen to rahega nahi, garz aur nafs parasti reh jaayegi. K kabhi us imam ki taqleed karen jo Kisi wajah se nikah ko fasid qarar dete hain aur kabhi us imam ki jo durust qarar dete hain apni garz aur khwahish ke mutabiq aur is tarah amal karna bil ittefaq na jaayez hai.
isi wajah se Ulama ne Aimma e Arba'h me se kisi ek ki Taqleed ko lazim aur zaruri qarar diya hai.

Kisi Hadees ka fee nafsihi sahi hona amal ke liye kafi nahi jab tak ye Maloom na ho jaaye ye hadees gair mansookh ya gair mu'awwal hai.

Aimma e Arba'h ke aqwaal mukhtalif kitabo me maujood hain jin me un hazraat ne waazeh taur par kaha hai k hamari har us baat ko maano jo Qur'an o Sunnat ke Muwafiq ho aur jo Khilaf ho us ko mat maano, matlab ye hua k wo apne aqwal par Amal ki Targeeb de rahe hain aur ye bhi bata rahe hain k in ke aqwal Qur'an o Sunnat ki Mukhalifat nahi karte, lehaza is se un ki Taqleed ka hukm un ke apne Aqwal se saabit hua.

Title: Kuch logo ka kehna hai ke Abdul Muttalib aur Abu Talib ke Janaze me Sarkaar ﷺ tashrif le gaye.
Content:
Kya ye baat sahi hai?

Agar sahi hai to daleel ke saath wajahat farmaye.

Isi baat ko lekar kuch log ye keh rahe hain ke kafiro ke janaze me jana chahiye.

40 kadam par chalna chahiye, kandha aur mitti nahi deni chahiye.

Kya unka ye kahna sahi hai?

Jawab:

Is tarah ki koi riwayat mere ilm me nahi.

Haan! ye Riwayat me hai ke Hazrat Ali Karramallahu Ta'ala Waj'hahul kareem ne Sarkar ﷺ ki khidmat me hazir ho kar bataya ke Aapka Buddha Chacha Mar Gaya.

To Huzoor e Aqdas ﷺ ne farmaya use mitti me thop do.

Wa-Allahu Ta'ala A'lam

Title: Hazrat aise alfaz kehne wale par kya Hukm hai jabki zaid ko kafi samjhaya gaya aur zaid huzoor tajushshariya sarkar ka mureed hai
Content:
Aur zaid ko huzoor tajushshariya ke jawab bhi sunaye gaye hai.

Fir bhi zaid ne aise alfaz kahe hai toh ispar kya Hukm hoga.

1) Ali Alaihisalam

2) Bhai panjetan e pak faristo se kam hai kya?

3) Hazrat Hussain na hote toh Islam bhi nahi hota aaj.

4) Mere liye panjetan e pak farishtey hi hai.

5) Shia shamjna hai samjho but panjetan e pak sir akho par.

6) Mere liye sahi hai mujhe kisise puchne ki zarurat nahi.

7) Panjetan e pak Alaihisalam

Hazrat jawab de kar rehnumaiye farmaye..

Jawab:

1) Gair E Ambiya o Malaika ke Naam ke Sath Alaihissalam ka istemaal Mamnoo hai, ke ye Ma'soomeen ke liye khas aur Alamat hai.

2) Panjatan e pak me Huzoor e Aqdas ﷺ Tamam Makhlooq me sab se Afzal aur Baqiya Sahaba e Kiraam Rusulaan e Malaaika Ke Siwa Tamam Farishto se Afzal hain.

Lehaza is jumle me harj nahi ke wo Farishto se kam nahi.

3) Islam ki Hifazat Allah Ta'ala ne Apne Zimma e karam par liya hai aur har zamane me kisi na kisi Apne Mahboob bande ke zariye se Allah ne Deen ki Hifazat farmaayi.

Lehaza ye jumla kehna ke Hussain na hote islam na hota. Yaani Khatam ho jaata, Mubaalga hai aisa jumla na kaha jaaye.

4) Ye Rawaafiz ka Aqeeda hai k wo Hazrat Ali, Hazrat Fatima o Hasnain e Kareemain رضی اللّٰــه تعالیٰ عنــــــــہم ko Ma'soom Maante hai.

Jab ke Ahle Sunnat o Jamaat ka aqeeda ye hai ke wo Ma'soom nahi, balke gunaaho se mahfooz hain.

Lehaza Unhe Is Maa'na me Farishta kehna ke wo Ma'soom hain, Ma'mool e Ahle Sunnat ke khilaaf hai.

5) Panjatan se Haqeeqi Muhabbat Sunni sahih ul Aqeeda rakhte hain na ke shia o rawafiz,

6) Inme se tamam bato ka jawab ijmalan zikr kar diya gaya, ab agar koi aisa jumla kahe ke mujhe kisi se poochne ki zarurat nahi.

Yaani agarche mai galat hu, to galat hi karunga Magar Ulama e kiram se daryaft na karunga.

To Aisa jumla Istemaal karna sakht gunah o Najaayez hai.

7) Jawab upar zikr hua.

Khalifa e Huzoor Tajushshariah
Mufti Maqsood Akhtar Qadri Razvi Amjadi
Khadim Dar al-Ifta Ridawi Amjadi

Durood sharrif ke fazail me imam sahab ne Yeh farmaya Yeh aisi ibadat hai jo ibadat allah taala bhi karta hai ya Yeh aisi Ibadat hai Jis me allah taala bhi sharik hai.yeh kehna kaisa hai.humne Yeh kayas kiya ki shayad daurane taqreer nikal gaya hoga par imam sahab ka kehna hai Yeh unhone hafiz ibne kaseer ke hawale se Bayan kiya.huzoor rehnumayi farmaye imam sahab ka aisa kehna hai

Jawaab:
Us Imam se ibn e Kaseer ki kitab ki Ibarat Hawale ke sath talab ki jaaye .. imam ka mazkoora jumla Qabil e Girift hai,

حضرت ایک سوال ھے کے Kiya aurat k mazar par aurat ja sakti h...?

Mazaraat par Aurato ka jaana Mamnoo hai.

Sawal : Zohr ki Sunnat e Mo'akadah mai teesri raka'at mai Surah Fateha ke baad tilawat karna bhul gaya aur Ruku kar liya to Kya Sajda e Sahw karna hoga ?

Agar Sajda e Sahw karna hoga aur naa kiya to Namaz Dohrani hogi ?

Baraye Karam Rehnumai farmaiye

Jawaab:
Mazkoora surat me Sajda e Sahw Waajib hai, Agar Sajda na kiya to Namaz wajibul iaada hogi

Title: Khade rehkar istinja kiya dhokar fir wazu karke namaz padha
Content:
To kya namaz huyi ya dohrana padhega
Woh paak raha, ya napak ho gaya ?

Jawab:

Khade ho kar peshab karna mamnoo hai aur agar aisi jagah khade ho kar peshab kiya jahan se chheente aane ka andesha hai to, Gunah hai.

Lehaza Agar khade ho kar kisi ne peshab kiya aur uski chheente kapde par agar bahot bareek sui ke nok ke barabar ho, to harj nahi aur agar aisi peshab ki bunde hain ke jinka majmua ek dirham ke barabar ho jaaye.

To kapda napaak aur napaak kapre me Namaz bhi na hogi.

Use chahiye ke wo Kapde Aur badan paak karke phir Namaz ada karein.

Title: Aurton aur mardon ki namaz alag alag kyu hai.
Content:
Kya Mohammad ﷺ ke waqt bhi namaz me farq tha.

Ahle hadees kahete hain ki aurton aur mardon ki namaz me koi farq nahi hai sahi kya hai aap bata dijiye hadees ya quran ke sath hawala bhi chahiye?

Jawab:

Aajkal Gair Muqallidiyat zada baaz TV channels par deeni program ke dar parda ek baat ye bhi mash'hoor ki ja rahi hai ke Mard aur Aurat ki Namaz ki Adaayegi ka tareeqe me koi farq nahi.

Jaise mard hazraat Namaz ke arkaan ada karte hain.

Aise hi Auratein bhi Namaz Ada karein.

Halaanke Ahle Sunnat o Jamat ka Mauqif ye hai ke Shariat e Islamiya me Ahkam e Khuda Wandi ke Mukhatab Mard o Aurat Dono hain.

Namaz, roza, hajj aur zakat ke Ahkam jis tarah mardo ke liye hain, Auratein bhi isse mustasna nahi.

Lekin Aurat ki niswaniyat aur parda ka khayal har maqaam par rakha gaya hai.

Un Ibadat ki adaayegi me aurat ke liye wo pehlu ikhtiyar kiya gaya hai, jisme mukammal parda hasil ho.

In ibadat ki adaigi aurat ke liye wo pehlu ikhtiyaar kiya gaya hai jisme mukammal parda hasil ho.

Ahadeese shareefa me ye baat bilkul wazeh ke Aurat or mard ke namaz ada karne ka tariqe me farq hai.

Wo kya farq hai?

Aaiye Ahadees ki roshni ne dekhe

Title: Qurbani ka gosht gair Muslim ko dena kaisa hai quran or hadees se Reference hona chahiye.
Content:
Kyuke humara padosi qafir hai to akhlaq kab batayenge hum zaid ka kehna hai.

Zaid ka kehna quran or hadees me hai ke padosi ka haq ada kiya jaye.

Jawab:

Qurbani agar kisi faqeer ne ki ho to uska gosht kisi kafir ko dena jaayez nahi.

Agar dega to utne gosht ka tawaan dena lazim hoga aur agar Gani ne Qurbani ki hai to gosht ka use ikhtiyaar hai.

Magar mustahab ye hai ke uske 3 hisse karle ek hissa apne liye, ek azeezo ke liye aur ek tasadduq ke liye.

Yahan ke kuffar ko dena in teeno mado'n se kharij hai.

Lehaza unhe dena khilaf e mustahab hai aur apne musalman bhai ko chhor kar dena himaaqat hai.

Yahan ke kafiro ko gosht dena jaayez nahi, wo khas musalmano ka haq hai.

Allah Ta'ala Ka irshad hai "tayyib Cheezein taiyyeb logo ke liye aur Taiyyeb log Taiyyeb cheezo ke liye" (26/24)

Phir bhi agar koi apni jihaalat se dega to qurbani me koi harj na karega.

Wa-Allahu Ta'ala A'lam

(Mulakkhasan Fatawa Razvia)
